Title: Perception
Important Commands: look, examine
As with real life, it takes work to perceive everything in a location in $(theatre.gamebrief).
You can learn about a room (or a person or an object) by typing $(udat.chatchar)LOOK AT [OBJECT] (or just $(udat.chatchar)LOOK to see the room you're in). This will give you a basic description. For example, $(udat.chatchar)LOOK AT AZRAEL returns "A plain looking person. He is wearing a tunic and a pair of sandals". You can then $(udat.chatchar)LOOK at one of the new details that have been revealed. For example $(udat.chatchar)LOOK AT AZRAEL'S TUNIC returns "An ordinary brown linen tunic".
Whenever you see something interesting, look at it and you'll continue learning more and more.
You can get more information about an object by typing $(udat.chatchar)EXAMINE (for your current room) or $(udat.chatchar)EXAMINE [OBJECT]. Examining takes a little bit of time, and everyone nearby will see what you are doing so. For example $(udat.chatchar)EXAMINE AZRAEL shows: "A plain looking person, with a head, a torso, and two arms and legs. He is wearing a tunic and a pair of sandals." Beware: some people might consider it rude for you to examine them.
